name: PythonScript
description: Runs a script with one or more interpreters.
helpMarkDown:
The *Run Python script* task will let you enter any script or command to run with the copies of Python installed by the Install Python task.

You can choose whether to run the script once for each installed Python or only once (with the latest version available).
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to Python. This should include at least a script filename, as well as arguments before and after.

inputs.name: workingdir
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where Python will be run.

inputs.name: onlyone
inputs.label: Only run once
inputs.helpMarkDown: When checked, only the latest Python version is used to execute the script. Otherwise, all discovered Python versions are used.

inputs.name: abortOnFail
inputs.label: Fail on non-zero exit code
inputs.helpMarkDown: Aborts the build by failing this task if the script returns a non-zero exit code.

inputs.name: python
inputs.label: Python
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory or directories containing the `python.exe` to use. By default, the last install added by either the Install Python or Use Python task will be used.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to install prior to running the script. Prefix with `--upgrade` to ensure you have the latest version.
